alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 8:28PM MDT until April 18 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Dodson affecting Phillips County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Dodson. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.2 feet, Lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM MDT Friday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to hover around 21.0 feet for the next several days. Future rises are possible. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.7 feet on 03/17/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
